intro: Albucea nutans, commonly known as the drooping morning glory, is a flowering plant belonging to the Convolvulaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pale blue or white, opening in the early morning. Albucea nutans is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shaded areas.
